AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: referred to as the Government, party in the legal case, argues about the validity of consent to search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court: concludes that Federico Saldana's consent was voluntary and valid, presided over the case of Federico Saldana, reviewed testimony about drug alerts in a vehicle search, signed documents on February 27, 2015, held a hearing and entered an opinion and order
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office: involved in drug interdiction cases and utilized a K-9 unit for searches, conducted investigation at a tire shop, participated in traffic stops and vehicle searches on Interstate 35, employer of detectives Gary Haston and Heather Vargas, observed suspicious modifications to vehicles, contacted a patrol deputy to conduct a traffic stop based on observations of unsafe driving, initiated a traffic stop on Interstate 35, gathered information from Federico Saldana during the stop, conducted search of the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer with consent from Federico Saldana, brought in a K-9 unit to conduct a search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox: Deputy who initiated the traffic stop on Interstate 35 and handled paperwork for the stop, participated in searching vehicles and retrieving cocaine, had an objectively reasonable suspicion of multiple traffic violations, attempted to locate registration papers, was in the process of gathering relevant information during Gary Haston's questioning, interacted with Federico Saldana in a cooperative manner, looked for registration documents in the car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Heather Vargas: Detective involved in providing traffic violation information and present at the scene after the stop, participated in searching vehicles, learning drug interdiction techniques from Gary Haston, searched in and around the flatbed trailer and 2008 Chevrolet truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana: Individual stopped by Jason Cox, admitted to prior arrests for smuggling illegal aliens and drugs, served 9 years in federal prison, arrested for transporting cocaine, moved to suppress the cocaine under his rights, exhibited unsafe driving behavior, gave consent for vehicle search, was detained during a valid traffic stop, had previously smuggled aliens and drugs using his 18-wheeler, showed signs of nervousness during questioning, demonstrated cooperation with officers during questioning, claimed he completed probation 3 years prior, stated he lived in Laredo and was driving the scissor lift to Dallas for repairs as a favor to Daniel Martin Huerta, denied presence of dope in the vehicle
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston: Detective who interrogated Federico Saldana about potential drug trafficking and conducted searches with a K-9 unit, retrieved cocaine from the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer, witnessed and reported traffic violations, asked questions about ownership and trip nature, questioned Federico Saldana during a valid detention, narcotics investigator with 17 years of experience, used persuasive language to elicit cooperation from suspects, gave Federico Saldana clear opportunities to object to or state problems with the search, teaching Heather Vargas drug interdiction techniques, observed suspicious vehicle modifications indicative of drug trafficking, described unsafe driving behavior of the 2008 Chevrolet truck, continued to gather information from Federico Saldana while Jason Cox looked for registration documents, obtained consent from Federico Saldana to search the vehicle, reapproached Federico Saldana and informed him they were bringing in a dog for a search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox and Gary Haston: Conducted cooperative and polite conversation with Federico Saldana regarding his traffic violations and trip itinerary
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court or judicial entity presiding over the case of Federico Saldana, signed documents by Judge Sam Sparks on February 27, 2015
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel Martin Huerta: Registered owner of the 2008 Chevrolet truck's trailer, license plate issued in Laredo on November 20, 2014, individual for whom Federico Saldana was driving the scissor lift to Dallas for repairs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Josiah Bennett: K-9 handler who conducted searches with his dog during the investigation and testified about the dog's alerts to narcotics
